TopicTitle: Tutorial on installing Kerbal Konstructs and Kerbin Side Remastered?

Articles.Content: Hi! I would like to install Kerbal Konstructs and Kerbin Side Remastered so does anyone have an idea in what folder of Kerbal Space Program do i extract the .zip files and do i need to leave the .zip file (the un-extracted one) into the folder where i've extracted the file?

Belated welcome to the forums!!!

For most mods, it's as simple as unzipping the .zip into a folder called Gamedata (that's where the mods go)

However, have a look in the mod's folder. If it has another Gamedata inside it, then you should put the contents of that in the main Gamedata.

You can keep the unextracted .zip if you want, but I usually delete it as it doesn't do anything and just takes up storage space.

However, have a look in the mod's folder. If it has another Gamedata inside it, then you should put the contents of that in the main Gamedata.

You can keep the unextracted .zip if you want, but I usually delete it as it doesn't do anything and just takes up storage space.

Well said sir, or use ckan if you are lazy.

38 minutes ago, Xd the great said:

Well said sir, or use ckan if you are lazy.

True, and while I use CKAN, it’s easy enough to install mods manually.

Ckan means you do not have to hunt for all dependencies one by one.

Good for very lazy people, such as me.
